intro: Husnotia, commonly known as the mountain buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow petals and is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions. The plant has palmately divided leaves and produces small, aggregate fruits. Husnotia thrives in moist, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous areas of Europe and Asia. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
